page.title: 02Transport
page.content: Swanley is well served by motorways.It is alongside the new orbital motorway the M25,this links directly with the A2/M2 which allows a route to London or the ports of Dover and Sheerness.Swanley lies directly along the M20/A20 which runs from Folkstone to London but is bypassed to save it from the worst of the traffic. The railway played a large part of Swanley's growth and is still an important means of transport,particlary for those who work in London.The southern region of British Rail links Swanley with the main London stations of Holborn Viaduct,Victoria or Blackfriars.The journey takes about 25 minutes. Bus routes link the town of Swanley with the local centres of Dartford, Bexley and Maidstone.
